alert.note: Alert for Holmes (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 22 at 1:12PM CDT until further notice by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HOLMES AND CENTRAL ATTALA COUNTIES... At 112 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing tornadoes were located along a line extending from near Emory to near Durant to near Newport, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... Possumneck and Mcadams around 120 PM CDT. Hesterville around 125 PM CDT. Kosciusko around 130 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these tornadic storms include West and Sallis. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
